title: Sins of Colonialism - Collection 9 (.. in the Americas 3)
description:
Sins of Colonialism - Collection 9 (.. in the Americas 3):

At the time of this upload, the genocide of the Palestinians in Gaza has resumed and it has been going for more than 50 days resulting in the killing of about 2100 civilians in addition to more than 11,000 wounded, with most of the casualties from among the children, women and the elderly.

It may seem odd to mention the war in Gaza when the topic of the upload is about "Sins of Colonialism in the Americas". But what we are witnessing in Gaza is a modern-day genocide of the native people of Palestine on the hands of migrating Jewish settlers - the same crime that was committed against the native people of the Americas on the hands of the European settlers.

We have 30 titles here:

-  Barrett - Geronimo; the True Story of America's Most Ferocious Warrior (2011)

-  Beidler - Murdering Indians; a Documentary History of the 1897 Killings That Inspired Louise Erdich's The Plague of Doves (2014)

-  Brumwell - White Devil; a True Story of War, Savagery, and Vengeance in Colonial America (2004)

-  Carter & McCormack (Eds.) - Recollecting; Lives of Aboriginal Women of the Canadian Northwest and Borderlands (2011)

-  Deloria - Indians of the Pacific Northwest from the Coming of the White Man to the Present Day (2012)

-  Denetdale - The Long Walk; the Forced Navajo Exile (2008)

-  Donovan - A Terrible Glory; Custer and the Little Bighorn; the Last Great Battle of the American West (2008)

-  Drury & Clavin - The Heart of Everything That Is; the Untold Story of Red Cloud, an American Legend (2013)

-  Greene - Morning Star Dawn; the Powder River Expedition and the Northern Cheyennes, 1876 (2003)

-  Grumet - First Manhattans; a History of the Indians of Greater New York (2011)

-  Hemming - The Conquest of the Incas (1970)

-  Iverson & Davies - We Are Still Here; American Indians since 1890, 2e (2015)

-  Jastrzembski - The Apache Wars; the Final Resistance (2007)

-  Jones - The Conquest of the Last Maya Kingdom (1998)

-  Jung - The Black Hawk War of 1832 (2007)

-  King - The Inconvenient Indian; a Curious Account of Native People in North America (2012)

-  MacQuarrie - The Last Days of the Incas (2007)

-  Marsico - Perspectives on the Trail of Tears; the Tragedy of the American Indians (2010)

-  Miller - The Force Removal of American Indians from the Northeast; a History of Territorial Cessions and Relocations, 1620-1854 (2011)

-  Prescott - History of the Conquest of Mexico (2001)

-  Preston - The Texture of Contact; European and Indian Settler Communities on the Frontiers of Iroquoia, 1667-1783 (2009)

-  Rielly - Legends of American Indian Resistance (2011)

-  Robertson - Conquest by Law; How the Discovery of America Dispossessed Indigenous Peoples of Their Lands (2005)

-  Robins - Native Insurgencies and the Genocidal Impulse in the Americas (2005)

-  Russell et al - The Cherokees, Indian of the Souteast; a Population History (1990)

-  Sonneborn - Chronology of American Indian History (2007)

-  Stevens - The Poor Indians; British Missionaries, Native Americans, and Colonial Sensibility (2004)

-  Stewart (Ed.) - Blood in the Hills; a History of Violence in Appalachia (2012)

-  Sugden - Blue Jacket; Warrior of the Shawnees (2000)

-  West - The Last Indian War; the Nez Perce Story (2009)
